channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report E-2023100578
item.description:
Report E-2023100578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEN experienced a NA1993 Sulfix 9670 Additive release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 25’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a puncture caused by a pallet of rods. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents, the cut up damaged tote, and impacted pallets were collected and containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023091033
item.description:
Report X-2023091033

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver placed a code 10 on the package due to damage and brought it back to the station. QA admin who picked it up placed it in a lined tote and brought it back to the damage area, moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023090659
item.description:
Report X-2023090659

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-09
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package handler in the unload notified QA admin of a damaged hazmat they had found in a trailer, explaining that the package had been found crushed under other packages. they had placed it in a lined tote. QA admin took the lined tote and brought it to the damage area, moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: the top of the box is crushed. the jerrican inside, which was surrounded by styrofoam peanuts, has a small crack in the top rim through which the product leaked. the staining on the top and side of the box implicates a high possibility that the package had been packed lying on its side and leaked so much during transit for this reason. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023080956
item.description:
Report X-2023080956

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023080956 A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the RSTR facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent found three smaller fiberboard boxes with bubble wrap as dunnage. And each inner box contained two plastic bottles. One of the six bottles had a loose cap and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement. X-2023080957 -A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the RSTR facility. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent found three smaller fiberboard boxes with bubble wrap as dunnage. And each inner box contained two plastic bottles. One of the six bottles had a loose cap and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report I-2023090156
item.description:
Report I-2023090156

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: Edina
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer location to fill a Dimethylformamide(DMF) tank. He verified the tank, quantity, and connection prior to starting to pump. After several moments after beginning transfer, customer employee notified driver that nothing was transferring. Driver inspected the connections and proceeded to check on the internal valve, which he closed and opened again. After doing so a cap on the rear of the trailer popped off and product started coming out of the open pipe. Driver shutdown the pump and approximately 90 gallons of DMF spilled into the customer's containment. The cause of the release was the result of a faulty outlet cap. During the investigation it was determined that there was no isolation valve installed behind the cap.
